docs.title: Contributing to the Docs
docs.text: These docs are generated using MkDocs with the Material for MkDocs theme.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
Clone the repo and change into the docs directory:

git clone git@github.com:lightningkite/mui-lightning-components.git
cd mui-lightning-components/docs

Install mkdocs and the Material theme:

pip install mkdocs
pip install mkdocs-material

Serve the docs locally on port 8000 with hot reloading:

mkdocs serve

docs.title: Adding a New Page
docs.text: To add a new page, create a new markdown file in the docs directory, then add it to the nav section of mkdocs.yml

docs.title: Publishing
docs.text:
To deploy changes to the docs:

mkdocs gh-deploy

docs.title: Using the Lightning Kite React Starter
docs.text: If you are using the Lightning Kite React Starter, you can skip this section. MUI Lightning Components is already installed and configured.

docs.title: Adding to an Existing Project
docs.text:
npm install @lightningkite/mui-lightning-components

MUI Lightning Components has the following peer dependencies; ensure they are also installed:

  • @emotion/react
  • @emotion/styled
  • @lightningkite/lightning-server-simplified
  • @mui/icons-material
  • @mui/material
  • @mui/x-data-grid
  • @mui/x-date-pickers
  • dayjs
  • formik
  • react
  • react-dom

MUI-X components require a localization provider be set up.

// App.tsx
import { LocalizationProvider } from "@mui/x-date-pickers";
import { AdapterDayjs } from "@mui/x-date-pickers/AdapterDayjs";

// ...

return (
  <LocalizationProvider dateAdapter={AdapterDayjs}>
    // ... your app here
  </LocalizationProvider>
);
